content: waste yarn co 26 sts onto a single needle knit back across the right side of the sweater is facing you and the working yarn is at the left edge working from the right edge move the first 4 sts to a second needle the next 9 sts to a third needle and the next 4 sts to a fourth needle begin working in the round round 1 k1 m1l k to last st on needle m1r k1 around 34 sts round 2 k around repeat these two rounds seven more times you will have 20 sts on the first and third sleeve needles and 25 sts on the second and fourth body needles 90 sts divide for sleeves *slip the 20 sleeve sts from the first needle onto waste yarn backwards loop co 2 sts then knit halfway across the body stitches on the next needle use another needle to complete knitting across the body stitches repeat once more from * 54 sts knit 22 more rounds transition round k7 k2tog around 48 sts bottom ribbing work 2 rounds k1p1 ribbing bobble sleeves make 2 transfer stitches of one sleeve from waste yarn to 3 needles round 1 with working yarn pick up the second of the two backwards-loop stitches pick up another stitch in the column just below the first needle then knit across the first needle with another needle knit across the second needle on the third needle work to the end then pick up one stitch in the column just below and pick up the last backwards-loop co stitch 24 sts decrease round k2tog knit to last 2 sts ssk 22 sts knit three rounds work another decrease round 20 sts work 2 rounds k1p1 rib bobble repeat with second sleeve crew neck collar pick up 26 sts from cast-on distribute across three or four needles work 2 rounds k1p1 ribbing bobble weave in ends closing any gaps at underarms as you go block sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 5 circular yoke worked in the round from the bottom up a few rounds packed with regularly-spaced increases give this distinctively scandinavian sweater its trademark shape the colorwork has been spaced to avoid conflicting with the increase rounds the turtleneck collar is worked directly from the yoke instead of being picked up afterward several row are worked flat before joining to help avoid twisting seam them together with the cast-on tail when you are weaving in the ends or forgo the flat construction and join immediately after casting on how to work basic stranded colorwork video tutorial from tin can knits https //youtu be/8-nhqvssiws sweater flight 1 by ouisi hamilton for chattanooga yarncrafters page # 6 circular yoke body with cc co 48 sts and work 2 row k1p1 ribbing row 3 k4 kfb k7 x5 kfb k3 54 sts row 4 with mc p across join to work in the round round 1 alternate cc and mc around break cc
